text: According to common law, a boy becomes a man at age sixteen at which point it becomes necessary for him to acquire the skills needful for his transition into adulthood. Perhaps it's time to invest in the education of your heir now that he is old enough,
A mind is a terrible thing to waste!

Today you suddenly realized that there are limits to what the body can do, and perhaps you have reached them. You had often wondered as a younger man what it is like to grow old. Well, now you know. But even as your body slows and creaks, your mind is as sharp as it has ever been. You've learned to relax and trust your instincts. Life for the old is simply a familiar dance that happens every year.
We can start recording our memoirs
A bit busy kinging at the moment

If the Kingdom will be governed by just laws then it becomes incumbent for its rulers to study that law that it may be imparted fairly. Studying law is quite arduous and requires a great deal of time and patience, but it will make you a more effective leader among men.
A man who knows the law can steal more than a hundred men with swords.

Becoming one of the most important scholarly minds of the medieval world grants one an interesting perspective on life. Among your peers you have become an intellectual giant. In the dark chambers of your mind, however, the discomforting truth is that as one learns more about the world around him it becomes quite larger than what it was before. The universe didnâ€™t shrink; it became more grand and mysterious than ever before. It calls out to you, but perhaps your energies should be spent to help guide your people...
There's life in these old bones yet!

Your heir is destined to inherit the Kingdom but he does not yet look the part! His appearance is slovenly, he twiddles his fingers, his posture is slightly bowed and his insecurities are all too often displayed in his countenance. Perhaps the time has come for you to begin personally grooming your heir until he is ready?
I don't have time for this
The future of the Kingdom demands it
Too much to do, never enough time

Your exploits on this earth are great and your deeds will be sung about for generations to come. You'll never be better than you are today. If you are lucky, by extraordinary effort, you can avoid slipping backwards for a while. But sooner or later, you're going to lose a step, or drop a beat, or miss a detail -- you'll make a fatal error. The pieces you leave behind will one day be picked up by younger men, but today you and your warriors will revel in your victory.
We'll build a statue in my honour

You can't believe how simple it is. You just have to have a little ambition and boldness and then, suddenly, everything you do turns to gold. Truly you have been blessed by the Gods! Or perhaps you should share credit with those who serve you. After all, what use is the mind without the fingers to do its bidding?

Most men view the sea as a barrier, but you see a road. Most men fear the nightmares of the deep, but you see an unexplored frontier. Most men seek shelter from the storm, but you face the wind and the cold as a loved one accepts a familial embrace.
I was born for the sea!
This noble has become close with the Vikings, drinking and hunting with their Sons. He requests that he be given leave to learn more about the Vikings, so as to negotiate with them on your behalf.
The Vikings are powerful, and will make for powerful allies.
Interesting... but we ought to keep to our own.

The robed clergymen flee from your soldiers like a warren of rabbits. Most are left alone but those who are too ill or too fat to flee are quickly cut down or are bound in fetters to be sold later on the market. The burning of their sanctuary produces a pungent mix of burning wood and incense -- the scattered remains of their parchments float lazily above the flames of the buildings. Your men drag a man towards you who is dressed slightly more extravagantly than the rest.... he must be one of the high priests.
Ransom this priest back to his people
One of your men is aware of your religious leanings and inquires if you will be dedicating your kill to SkaÃ°i, a jÃ¶tunn and goddess associated with bowhunting, skiing, winter, and mountains.
Of course. Our kill came from the Gods.
The Gods aren't willing to do anything I'm not willing to do for myself.

As the darkness of the evening falls on the treetops some of the berserkirs in your army invite you to a small ritual site at the edge of the woods. The bonfire roars as the GyÃ°ja takes an engraved knife and begins her work of opening the throats of many different animals, especially horses. She instructs her followers to catch the blood from the sacrificed animals in bowls and twigs are used to spatter the blood on altars, walls and other participants standing nearby. One of the hofgothi approaches you specifically with a small sample of the blÃ³t sacrifice in her hands and a look of expectation in her eyes. The nature of your invitation to the ritual suddenly dawns on you as one of the nearby berserkirs places a brotherly hand on your shoulder.

Some of the men in your army invite you to a small site at the edge of the woods. The bonfire roars as the GyÃ°ja takes an engraved knife and begins opening the throat of a horse. Her followers catch the blood and use twigs to spatter the liquid on nearby participants. One of the hofgothi approaches you specifically with a small sample of the blÃ³t sacrifice in her hands and a look of expectation in her eyes. The nature of your invitation becomes clear as one of the nearby berserkirs places a brotherly hand on your shoulder.

Looking on your armies causes you to reflect on the state of life for your men. They work all day every day for a loaf of bread and a pot to piss in. Their families die in sickness and hunger, and yet their King still asks them to give up their lives in battle. But when that land is threatened, something stirs in their chest that causes them to turn out and fight. It can only be love. From wretch to warrior, love gives these men strength to defend their home. Perhaps the King can do more to love these men, as they have loved him.
Let my people keep more of the food that they sow

You had a dream last night of stumbling through a dark and dreary world -- the darkness is the sorrow that you bring to others, the burden on your shoulders is the weight of your misdeeds in this life. Ghosts of men point at you accusingly as you pass them by, eagerly waiting for the day that you will join them in their misery. The Christian priests claim that all can be forgiven of their sins through the power of the Holy Saints. Perhaps it's time we pay them a visit...
Repent and thou shalt be saved!
Nonsense. I did what I had to

There have been some grumblings in your Kingdom of late concerning the administering of the Holy Communion under both kinds (consecrated bread and wine) in the church. According to tradition, the clergy have been the only ones who would receive the consecrated wine. There are certain upstarts, however, who claim that Christ passed the cup to fisherman as an example that all were equal under God, and that all should have a chance to drink the holy wine. This dispute has the potential to tear your Kingdom apart and must be resolved.
Reassert the authority of the Church
Reprimand the clergy and request they share the wine

No earthly pleasures, no kingdoms of this world can benefit me in any way. I prefer death in Christ to power over the farthest limits of the earth. He who died in place of us is the one object of my quest. He who atoned for our sins is my one desire. In this I cannot please both God and the world at the same time. They are utterly opposed to each other in their thoughts, their desires, and their actions.
It becometh us to fulfill all righteousness

With the remains of the town still smoldering around you, your men bring you a young man with his eyes set in angry defiance. Apparently this is the son of the late Earl and was hiding in a cellar as you were sacking the town. His family may pay a handsome price for his safe return... on the other hand, the son of your enemy will grow up. And when he's grown, he'll remember the man who killed his father and come for revenge.
You can't be too careful nowadays
His pretty head will fetch a pretty coin

Your victim is laid at your feet, shaking and crying. His eyes are full of pain and confusion at the events that have transpired in the last while. He woke up this morning, sure that his life would extend for many years still. He had plans and ambitions; he's still trying to understand what has happened and why everything will suddenly be nothing very soon. But broken men can sometimes be shown reason...
I do what I want, the consequences be damned!
We've broken him, now let's reshape him

On a chilly morning, your guards bring your treacherous subject to your hall, kicking and screaming. The man has been spreading lies and other poisonous rumours about you behind your back. Even now, he curses your name and spits on your feet. He will not beg nor will he stand to be indebted to you. An example must be made of him so that your subjects will know what happens when they seek to overthrow their King. It's an unfortunate business... we can do it quick, or we can have some fun.
Let us end this traitor nice and slow
A public execution will remind everyone who the King is!
Ruling a kingdom is like being a tree. The bigger it gets the more it needs to eat, and thus its roots must spread out further than ever before.
Let us improve on what we have for now

The recent peasant uprisings are a direct challenge to your authority. Perhaps being kind was the wrong approach before; perhaps you were too trusting of those around you. Perhaps it's time to twist the screws and become the nasty ruler they make you out to be. The security of the Kingdom demands you take action!
Let's remind them who rules this Kingdom
Maybe we've been a bit too harsh

A man from another Kingdom approaches you at court and claims to represent a "concerned friend" who has taken an interest in your situation. His friend wishes to help restore your reputation and is prepared to fully utilize his resources in spreading your good works among your people in order that they will again recognize you for the great leader you are. The only request is that we feed him yearly information about the movements of our armies as well as those of our allies. Will you honour this manâ€™s request?
My honour is not for sale
No one will ever know anyways
That which is done in the dark, will always be brought into the light

What shall I do with subjects who are so openly hostile to their King and determined to upset the safety of our lands? If the crew of a ship seeks to burn their own vessel and sink her, is it not incumbent on the captain to sacrifice everything needful to ensure they don't sink? When the fox is at the door, shall the chicks scorn their mother who has only sought their protection and throw her out? No more! My nobles may not love me or respect me -- but, by God, they shall obey me!
The nobles will be made to listen

Your advisor approaches you with troubling news about the finances of our Kingdom -- we're spending far more than our coffers can withstand. We need to either cut back on expenditures... or ahem, find more creative ways to make ends meet. Taking bribes, embezzling royal funds, charging extortionary amounts of interest on loans; these, of course, are just temporary solutions until we can get back on steady ground.
How dare you suggest the King take a bribe!

Your advisors bring you reports of highwaymen throughout your kingdom who terrorize the roads for travellers and farmers. Their presence is a scourge on your people and the peace of the Kingdom! Rooting them out takes considerable time and resources. Or perhaps there is a more cost-effective solution to dealing with these ruffians?
Root them all out. I am the law!
Perhaps guard tolls would be helpful?

One of your nobles approaches you with an offer: apparently they have captured a wealthy family member from a rival kingdom and wish to ransom them back. They wish to do so under your protection and promise you half of the bounty if they can close a deal with the royal family. It will be a rather large sum of money that we definitely come in handy.
The ransom will be worth quite a bit of gold

To be able to stand upright and honourable in the eyes of your peers is truly one of the most satisfying experiences a man can have. Even those who are your enemies know of your integrity and respect you for it.
I stand as judge of this Kingdom
I pass judgment like the Solomon the Wise
We'll write a manuscript on law instead
We can still pass our influence on, and make a tidy sum in the process

Of all your many talents mercantilism was never your strongest suite, but it would seem in your best interest to improve your skills. After all if something was to happen to you, your family will still need to be taken care of, debts will need to be paid off and, dare I say, it will be nice to have an extra jingle in your pockets as well. With all of these merchants and traders walking around surely there can be one from whom we can glean some business wisdom.
Let's hire someone who can teach us
We have other matters to attend to

Your nobles approach you at court, insisting that the tax rate be lowered immediately. They also subtly hint as some "unfortunate incident" that might possibly occur if the situation does not soon change. The nerve of these men, openly making threats against their King! The Kingdom only asks what is needed to provide for their safety, and these men have clearly allowed their personal holdings sway their loyalty to the King. We could take them at their word and acquiesce... then again; few men were ever remembered for playing it safe.
They will pay for their arrogance

Some of the captains in your army approach you with a somewhat nervous look. After a quick bow they disclose that the men in your army have been extra concerned about the harvest this year and ensuring that their families will have enough support. The year is assumed to be extra worse weather-wise and it is distracting them from their military duties. Will we lend a helping hand to support our men?
Our families will just have to manage on their own
We can host a regular farmer's market if you fund the gathering place in town for it.
We will bring the farmer's together

Men amuse themselves nightly around the campfire at night with tales of local folklore... but on this night the men ask you for tales of your own exploits. Such an act might be viewed as vain and self-serving... usually in such matters it is best to rely on a modest tale which is easily relatable to others. But perhaps it wouldn't come off badly to share on your more "colourful" adventures.
Modesty is a virtue, after all
The man asked you first and the current spirit is good for a an exciting story
Your people love you, and you them. Even when your body is cold and buried your memory will live on in the tales sung by parents to their children about their Beloved King.
Let us discuss gifts for all of your nobles

Life isn't over. You can still get smarter, cleverer, more experienced, or meaner -- but your body and soul just aren't going to get any younger. The challenge now is to stay at the peak as long as you can. You may be as strong today as any man, but there's always someone younger, a new challenger who wants to take down the old man.
It may be time to retire soonâ€¦
This noble has become close with the Vikings, drinking and hunting with their Sons. He requests that he be given leave to learn more about the Vikings, so as to negotiate with them on your behalf.
Let him tend to his normal duties.
This noble has invited a group of foreigners to settle in his lands. They would make useful mercenaries, but their presence would lend significant authority to their favoured lord.
Good soldiers are hard to find, we shouldn't turn them away out of fear that our nobles might betray us.
It is dangerous to allow our nobles to hire foreigners. We will pay them a small sum to find employment outside of our Kingdom.
This noble is becoming very popular with the peasants. Luckily for us, they're peasants.\\n
We will overshadow his contributions with our own charity
If he wishes to waste his coin on the peasantry, so be it.

Word reaches you that this noble has been misusing funds intended to pay soldiers and maintain fortifications. Such immoral behaviour weakens our Kingdom from within, yet it may be politically inconvienient for you to put a stop to it.
Troublesome as this noble has become, their services are still necessary.
A very public reprimand will convince this general to change his ways, but he isn't going to be happy about it.
Word reaches you that this noble, long disloyal to your rule, has been associating with known traitors and making suspicious deals with unsavoury thugs.
This man is a spineless coward, he poses no threat to us.
Those who defy their King have a habit of disappearing.
Publicly exposing his disloyalty will cause other nobles to stay clear of his influence.

The merchants and lesser nobles governed by this noble have petitioned you to intervene in his tax collection, which has become increasingly demanding in recent months, and is causing increasing anger in our Kingdom. They ask for a repreive.
We will ask our Governor to relax his efforts, and give the merchants a reasonable sum to compensate them for their trouble.
